==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{ja-kanjitab|手|甲}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=てっこう|手|tr1=te|t1=hand|甲|tr2=kō|t2=shell; armor; back of the hand or foot}}, with the medial ''-k-'' becoming [[geminate]]. Original reading ''tekō'' still persists as an alternate, albeit less common, pronunciation.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|湯桶読み|Yutōyomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|て|っこ|う}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[te̞kːo̞ː]|[te̞ko̞ː]}} {{qualifier|second reading is less common}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|てっこう}} {{ja-altread|hira=てこう|rom=tekō}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=てっこう|anatomy}} the [[back]] of the [[hand]]
# a piece of [[armor]] or [[clothing]] for [[protect]]ing the back of the hand, such as a [[glove]] or [[gauntlet]]

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-l|手甲鉤|てっこうかぎ|tekkō kagi}}

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|anatomy}} {{ja-l|手の甲|てのこう|te no kō}}, {{ja-l|手の表面|てのひょうめん|te no hyōmen}}
* {{sense|gauntlet}} {{ja-l|籠手}}, {{ja-l|篭手|こて|kote}}
* {{sense|glove}} {{ja-l|手袋|てぶくろ|tebukuro}}
